text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1988, the Megadrive or Genesis in America, is a Sega console based on the architecture of their Arcade System 16. Taking shot at Nintendo 16-bit market, Sega managed to position itself in the United States and Europe, sweeping the way to the PC Engine. It has a 7.6 MHz processor, 74 KB of RAM, a 320x224 display, and FM stereo sound. In 1991 the mascot of the brand Sonic the Hedgehog was released, followed by two excellent sequels. The Megadrive is also known for Disney Aladdin, EA sports games, and the uncensored version of Mortal Kombat!
